greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Given n-th prime p, a(n) = number of primes of the form p + q - 1 where q is any prime < p.
comment: Conjecture: a(n)>0 for all n>2. - _Dmitry Kamenetsky_, Feb 09 2017
link: Alois P. Heinz, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: Table[p = Prime[n]; c = 0; i = 1; While[i < n, If[PrimeQ[p + Prime[i] - 1], c = c + 1]; i++]; c, {n, 72}]
results.author: _Jayanta Basu_, Apr 17 2013
